newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire says army pushes back rebels from Kindu.
newsitem.headline: Zaire says army pushes back rebels from Kindu.

text.p: Zaire's army ambushed rebels advancing on the eastern town of Kindu, killing hundreds, and forcing others to retreat eastwards, the defence ministry said on Wednesday.
A senior defence official told Reuters the rebels were ambushed on Tuesday night 35 km (22 miles) from Kindu at a road junction at the village of Muyengo.

"They were moving up the road calmly, apparently expecting no resistance. The Zairean army ambushed them at the junction between two roads leading north to Punia and west to Kindu," the official said.
"There were hundreds killed and the rest were forced to retreat towards Kalima in the early hours," he added.
The official said that Zairean army units were pursuing the rebels eastwards towards the town of Kalima, which the rebels took last weekend.

The rebels took up arms last October and seized towns and territory in the east. They blunted a much-vaunted army counter-offensive by attacking on several fronts. Zaire accuses Rwanda, Uganda and Burundi of invading to fight alongside them. All three deny the charge.
